content.body: Could use editor review on https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/10043 (easy) and https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/10168 (bigger)
Is it expected that cryptographic keys created by SubtleCrypto are stored in a fun and secure place like a Trusted Platform Module or Secure Enclave?
Or would that just be a quality of implementation bonus
it's not expected and afaiu subtlecrypto predates wide availability and adoption of TPM / enclaves
Domenic: I'll leave the bigger one for zcorpan.
content.formatted_body: Domenic: I'll leave the bigger one for zcorpan.

content.body: yulia | sick: https://github.com/w3c/trusted-types/issues/471 is probably of interest to you. Maybe also to littledan.

content.body: freddy: you too I suppose. Some of the research participants could really use a built-in sanitizer.
